verses.verse: For from Israel is even this: A (Is. 40:19) workman made it, and it is not God; But the calf of Samaria shall be broken to pieces.
“They (Prov. 22:8) sow the wind, And reap the whirlwind. The stalk has no bud; It shall never produce meal. If it should produce, (Hos. 7:9) Aliens would swallow it up.
(2 Kin. 17:6; Jer. 51:34) Israel is swallowed up; Now they are among the Gentiles (Jer. 22:28; 25:34) Like a vessel in which is no pleasure.
For they have gone up to Assyria, Like (Hos. 7:11; 12:1; Jer. 2:24) a wild donkey alone by itself; Ephraim (Ezek. 16:33, 34) has hired lovers.

Yes, though they have hired among the nations, Now (Ezek. 16:37; 22:20) I will gather them; And they shall sorrow a little, Because of the burden of (Is. 10:8; Ezek. 26:7; Dan. 2:37) the king of princes.
“Because Ephraim has made many altars for sin, They have become for him altars for sinning.
I have written for him ((Deut. 4:6-8); Ps. 119:18; 147:19, 20) the great things of My law, But they were considered a strange thing.

For the sacrifices of My offerings (Zech. 7:6) they sacrifice flesh and eat it, (Jer. 14:10; Hos. 6:6; 9:4; 1 Cor. 4:5) But the LORD does not accept them. (Hos. 9:9; Amos 8:7; Luke 12:2) Now He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins. They shall return to Egypt.

“For (Deut. 32:18; (Hos. 2:13; 4:6; 13:6)) Israel has forgotten (Is. 29:23) his Maker, And has built temples; Judah also has multiplied (Num. 32:17; 2 Kin. 18:13) fortified cities; But (Jer. 17:27) I will send fire upon his cities, And it shall devour his palaces.”

Judgment of Israel’s Sin Do (Is. 22:12, 13; Hos. 10:5) not rejoice, O Israel, with joy like other peoples, For you have played the harlot against your God. You have made love for (Jer. 44:17) hire on every threshing floor.
The threshing floor and the winepress Shall not feed them, And the new wine shall fail in her.
They shall not dwell in ((Lev. 25:23); Jer. 2:7) the LORD’s land, (Hos. 7:16; 8:13) But Ephraim shall return to Egypt, And (Ezek. 4:13) shall eat unclean things in Assyria.

They shall not offer wine offerings to the LORD, Nor (Jer. 6:20) shall their (Hos. 8:13; Amos 5:22) sacrifices be pleasing to Him. It shall be like bread of mourners to them; All who eat it shall be defiled. For their bread shall be for their own life; It shall not come into the house of the LORD.
What will you do in the appointed day, And in the day of the feast of the LORD?

For indeed they are gone because of destruction. Egypt shall gather them up; Memphis shall bury them. (Is. 5:6; 7:23; Hos. 10:8) Nettles shall possess their valuables of silver; Thorns shall be in their tents.

The (Is. 10:3; Jer. 10:15; Mic. 7:4; Luke 21:22) days of punishment have come; The days of recompense have come. Israel knows! The prophet is a (Lam. 2:14; (Ezek. 13:3, 10)) fool, (Mic. 2:11) The spiritual man is insane, Because of the greatness of your iniquity and great enmity.
The (Jer. 6:17; 31:6; Ezek. 3:17; 33:7) watchman of Ephraim is with my God; But the prophet is a fowler’s snare in all his ways— Enmity in the house of his God.
